alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Pottawattamie; Shelby (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 3:39AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pottawattamie, southeastern Harrison and southwestern Shelby Counties through 415 AM CDT... At 339 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles northwest of Underwood, or 15 miles north of Council Bluffs, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Neola around 350 AM CDT. Minden around 355 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Persia and Shelby. This includes Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 17 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
